package main

// This is a comment in GO

import (
	"fmt" // fmt is a package that provides formatting functions for printing and scanning
	"math/rand" // rand is a package that provides pseudo-random number generation
)

func main() {

	// using the Println function from the fmt package to print out a message
	fmt.Println("Welcome to my GO code snippet!")

	// creating a variable to store the random number generated by the Intn function from the rand package 
	var randomNum int = rand.Intn(100)

	// printing out a message with the generated random number 
	fmt.Println("Your random number is:", randomNum)

	// using an if-else statement to check if the random number is even or odd
	if (randomNum % 2) == 0 {
		fmt.Println("Your random number is even!")
	} else {
		fmt.Println("Your random number is odd!")
	}

	// using a for loop to print out the first 10 multiples of the random number
	for i := 1; i <= 10; i++ {
		fmt.Println("Multiple", i, ":", randomNum*i)
	}
}

// Expected Output: 
// Welcome to my GO code snippet!
// Your random number is: [random number]
// Your random number is [even/odd]!
// Multiple 1: [random number]
// Multiple 2: [random number * 2]
// Multiple 3: [random number * 3]
// Multiple 4: [random number * 4]
// Multiple 5: [random number * 5]
// Multiple 6: [random number * 6]
// Multiple 7: [random number * 7]
// Multiple 8: [random number * 8]
// Multiple 9: [random number * 9]
// Multiple 10: [random number * 10]
